description:
'''Hardstep''' is a subgenre of [[drum and bass]] which emerged in the mid-1990s. It is characterized by a gritty production style that consists of an inner-city feel. The breaks are less choppy than [[Jungle music|oldschool jungle]], and have faster and harder simple electronic melodies. One characteristic is an accentuated, and yet sparse percussive [[Beat (music)|beat]].

The [[Music genre|genre]] found favor with [[junglist]]s, and though it has been overtaken in popularity by [[techstep]], the fans of the style still remain. Early hardstep [[Musician|artists]] include [[DJ Hype]], and [[DJ Zinc]].
